column4: Hello! Having an issue installing Ubuntu on a laptop with a broken monitor. I can't get it to swap to the external.
The install itself went well, but now booting it up it seems it's defaulted to the laptop monitor and is ignoring the HDMI one
FN+f4 does nothing, it seems
That's the display changer on this laptop
It's fubar, backlight's dead. I can kinda make out shapes with the aid of a flashlight, but I can't see the mouse or anything detailed.
chances are it doesn't activate the external monitor by default but you need to do it manually (using software and configurations)
are you into the linux shell, i.e. working with a temrinal?
do you know which video card you have ther eon this laptop?
okay, xrandr would be my plan, too
do you have an integrated grpahics chipset, too?
are you using the nouveau (open source) or (proprietary) nvidia drivers?
and which "initial install configuration screen" are you referring to?
okay, sorry i didn't think much there ;-)
how did you install in the first place then?
does it output to both screens during boot?
i'd say reinstall using the alternative installer, and make sure you install an ssh server on it in the end, and test that you can connect to it fine.
tat'd be my suggestion. so you can change configuration back and forth easily and can always see what's going on.
otherwise it'll just be annoying.

so when the alternative installer is done and wants to reboot, cacel and get back to that main menu where all the installation steps are listed. on the very bottom you should see an option to run a shell.
i think it also provides instrcutions on how to access the location where it has installed ubuntu to. you will probably have to chroot to that and install the openssh package there manually
openssh-server, that is.
